title: How to Make Cake Batter Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.
Prepare your baking pan.
steps.description: Using a pastry brush, spread melted butter over your baking pan.

steps.headline: Mix the cake mix, egg, and vegetable oil.
steps.description: In a mixing bowl, stir the cake mix, egg, and vegetable oil together with a rubber spatula or whisk. Take caution not to over-mix as this causes your brownies to be rubbery.

steps.headline: Slowly pour the mix to the cake batter.
steps.description: Milk is the key ingredient to this recipe, because the amount you put will determine the moistness of your brownies. Too much milk will cause the brownies to come out tasting more like a cake. Mix again with the rubber spatula. The batter should be slightly thick but still liquid.

steps.headline: Add the white chocolate chips and sprinkles.
steps.description: The tasty and colorful part! Pour both ingredients in your batter and mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the baking pan.
steps.description: Scrape any remaining batter with a rubber spatula. Lightly sprinkle some more sprinkles on top.

steps.headline: Bake for 25-30 minutes.
steps.description: The edges should be brown when your brownies are ready.

steps.headline: Cool for 30 minutes.
steps.description: This step is extremely important and should not be skipped. Immediately after you take your brownies out, do not slice them, instead give them the time to cool. Your brownies should still be slightly gooey right after they come out of the oven.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Use a knife to cut the brownies into squares. They are ready to serve.

text: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.  Prepare your baking pan. Using a pastry brush, spread melted butter over your baking pan. Mix the cake mix, egg, and vegetable oil. In a mixing bowl, stir the cake mix, egg, and vegetable oil together with a rubber spatula or whisk. Take caution not to over-mix as this causes your brownies to be rubbery. Slowly pour the mix to the cake batter. Milk is the key ingredient to this recipe, because the amount you put will determine the moistness of your brownies. Too much milk will cause the brownies to come out tasting more like a cake. Mix again with the rubber spatula. The batter should be slightly thick but still liquid. Add the white chocolate chips and sprinkles. The tasty and colorful part! Pour both ingredients in your batter and mix until well-combined. Pour the batter into the baking pan. Scrape any remaining batter with a rubber spatula. Lightly sprinkle some more sprinkles on top. Bake for 25-30 minutes. The edges should be brown when your brownies are ready. Cool for 30 minutes. This step is extremely important and should not be skipped. Immediately after you take your brownies out, do not slice them, instead give them the time to cool. Your brownies should still be slightly gooey right after they come out of the oven. Serve. Use a knife to cut the brownies into squares. They are ready to serve. Enjoy!
